sense.name: Sever or remove (pieces of), as when tending or cultivating plants or objects; move as if to do so.
sense.examples: Snip off the flowers and put them in the vase. I snipped the dead leaves from the bushes in the yard. We should snip the stray pieces of yarn from the sweater. She snipped at the bushes. Her husband snipped at her with kitchen shears.

sense.name: SNIP AT: speak harshy or shortly (with someone).
sense.examples: Please don't snip at me! I snipped at the small child and she started to cry.

sense.name: SNIP AT: bite at, as an animal might.
sense.examples: The large dog snipped at the smaller one. The rabbit snipped at my face.

sense.name: Spay, neuter, castrate; render infertile.
sense.examples: We snipped our dog first thing after getting him from the breeder. She had her husband snipped; she didn't want any more children. We made sure to snip our girl puppy before letting her outside.
